description._content: Get a list of referring domains for a collection

response._content:
<domains page="1" perpage="25" pages="1" total="3">
	<domain name="images.search.yahoo.com" views="127" />
	<domain name="flickr.com" views="122" />
	<domain name="images.google.com" views="70" />
</domains>

explanation._content:
There is one <domain> element for each referring domain, with attributes for the domain name and the number of views.

For details on the referrers coming from each domain listed you can call flickr.stats.getCollectionReferrers

argument.name: api_key
argument._content: Your API application key. See here for more details.

argument.name: date
argument._content:
Stats will be returned for this date. This should be in either be in YYYY-MM-DD or unix timestamp format.

A day according to Flickr Stats starts at midnight GMT for all users, and timestamps will automatically be rounded down to the start of the day.

argument.name: collection_id
argument._content: The id of the collection to get stats for. If not provided, stats for all collections will be returned.

argument.name: per_page
argument._content: Number of domains to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 25. The maximum allowed value is 100.

argument.name: page
argument._content: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

error._content: The user you have requested stats has not enabled stats on their account.
No stats are available for the date requested. Flickr only keeps stats data for the last 28 days.
The date provided could not be parsed
The collection id was either invalid or was for a collection not owned by the calling user.
SSL is required to access the Flickr API.
The call required signing but no signature was sent.
The login details or auth token passed were invalid.

error.message: User not logged in / Insufficient permissions
error._content: The method requires user authentication but the user was not logged in, or the authenticated method call did not have the required permissions.
The API key passed was not valid or has expired.
The requested service is temporarily unavailable.
The requested operation failed due to a temporary issue.
The requested response format was not found.
The requested method was not found.
The SOAP envelope send in the request could not be parsed.
The XML-RPC request document could not be parsed.
One or more arguments contained a URL that has been used for abuse on Flickr.
